abstract: The move represents a backtracking of sorts for the Irish government, which has said that it would be more expensive to close Anglo Irish than to keep it going as a smaller institution.
snippet: The move represents a backtracking of sorts for the Irish government, which has said that it would be more expensive to close Anglo Irish than to keep it going as a smaller institution.
lead_paragraph: The Irish government, bowing to market fears that its escalating banking losses might cause it to default, said Wednesday that it would split the Anglo Irish Bank into two entities, one of which would eventually cease operations, The New York Times’s Landon Thomas Jr. reported.

headline.main: Ireland Moves to Split Up Troubled Anglo Irish Bank
